item.title: Pokemon GO Players Can Catch a Free Mewtwo in March Event
item.description:
Pokemon GO players will have a chance to encounter and catch Mewtwo as part of an upcoming limited event for Pokemon 's 30th anniversary. Pokemon GO is set to end its Precious Paths season on March 2, making way for its much-anticipated Memories in Motion era. An exciting month is coming for Pokemon GO players, with a fan-favorite Legendary monster making a comeback after four years.

2026 is a big year for Pokemon GO . Aside from the game's 10th anniversary, the Pokemon franchise itself recently turned 30. To commemorate the milestone, Pokemon GO revealed its Anniversary All Out event for March 7 to 9. According to developer Scopely, "almost all" Pokemon that have been released in Pokemon GO will spawn in the wild. This will give fans a chance to complete their Pokedex by catching creatures that would otherwise be too hard to find. The event has exceptions, though, as Pokemon like Kecleon, Smeargle, or Scatterbug will remain locked behind special mechanics. Some Mythical and Legendary monsters, like Cosmog, Zygarde, and Mewtwo, are also part of this list. Fortunately for players, the latter is returning to Pokemon GO , and fans won't have to participate in Raids to catch it.

Pokemon GO Confirms Free Mewtwo Encounter for Pokemon 30th Anniversary Event

From Tuesday, March 3, to Monday, March 9, Pokemon GO will hold its Pokemon 30th Anniversary event, which features a limited-time GO Pass that leads to an encounter with Mewtwo. If they're lucky, fans might even encounter a shiny Mewtwo. Completing tasks and progressing through the GO Pass will also grant players encounters with Kanto Pokemon and Candy. Additionally, fans can purchase the GO Pass Deluxe starting at US$7.99 to get extra rewards like Mewtwo Candy XL, encounters with the Legendary Bird Trio, and Rare Candy. It was previously revealed that Mewtwo would return for Pokemon GO Fest 2026, which is expected for June. It seems players won't have to wait too long anymore for the Legendary Psychic-type.

The event will also see any Pokemon originally from Kanto spawning in the wild, excluding Mewtwo, Mew, and regional Pokemon. It is worth noting that the Kanto forms of Articuno, Zapdos, and Moltres will appear in the wild as well, despite normally being locked behind Raids. Reaching GO Pass Tiers 1 and 2 gives fans valuable bonuses like double Catch Candy and double XP, respectively. To help players complete the GO Pass faster, there won't be a daily limit of GO Pass points from March 7 to 9. Moreover, fans should be on the lookout for Pokemon GO Raids, since 1-Star Raids will feature Pikachu wearing Red and Leaf's hats, and 3-Star Raids will see Venusaur, Charizard, and Blastoise. Finally, Ditto will be changing into many different wild Pokemon.

It is common for Legendary Pokemon to be event-exclusive, but many tend to return within months. However, while Shadow Mewtwo was featured in a 2024 limited event, its original form hasn't returned to Pokemon GO since 2022. For players who have previously missed out on catching Mewtwo, the upcoming 30th Anniversary GO Pass can be their best chance at adding the Legendary.

Subscribe to our newsletter for Pokemon GO coverage and strategy

Unlock deeper event breakdowns—subscribe to the newsletter for practical Pokemon GO tactics, step-by-step catch walkthroughs, and clear analysis to approach limited encounters with confidence and make smarter in-game decisions.
By subscribing, you agree to receive newsletter and marketing emails, and accept our Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. You can unsubscribe anytime.

On the other hand, some players believe that the game could finally release Mega Mewtwo X and Y later in the year. Pokemon GO recently introduced Super Mega Raids, tougher Raids that let fans catch stronger Mega Evolutions like Mega Victreebel and Mega Dragonite. Since Mewtwo will be part of GO Fest 2026, there's a chance it could be added to Super Mega Raids. In the meantime, fans can look forward to Pokemon GO 's Memories in Motion season, which will run from March 3 to June 2 and is set to debut several new Pokemon.

Pokémon GO

item.title: All Wrenwood Files in Resident Evil Requiem
item.description:
Files are one of the collectibles in Resident Evil 9 Requiem that are tied to the Case Closed trophy and achievement. They're hidden throughout various areas you'll visit in the game, and you'll start collecting these as early as the start of the game while heading towards Wrenwood Hotel. Here's a guide to help you locate all five Wrenwood files in RE9 .

Check out our interactive map for Resident Evil Requiem right here.

Where to Find All Files and Documents in Wrenwood (Resident Evil 9 Requiem)

Wrenwood File 1 - Investigation Report

As soon as players take control of Grace at the start of Resident Evil Requiem (RE9) , go into your inventory and examine the Investigation Report . Open up the file by inspecting it and interacting with the documents inside.

Wrenwood File 2 - Wrenwood City Guide

While walking down the streets of Wrenwood City, you'll find a flyer posted on the City Map board to the right. This will add Wrenwood City Guide to your files in RE9 .

Wrenwood File 3 - Hotel Pamphlet

After entering the Wrenwood Hotel, you'll eventually unlock a door leading to another section of the lobby with an old key. As soon as you enter this area, you'll find the Hotel Pamphlet on the floor, right next to the golden luggage cart .

Wrenwood File 4 - Notice of Closure

Right after picking up the Hotel Pamphlet, head towards the reception desk by the stairs, and go into the room to the left. There's a blue desk inside the room that you can go around and open up its drawer to get the Notice of Closure file in Resident Evil Requiem .

Wrenwood File 5 - Alyssa’s Journal

After the flashback, Grace will retrieve Alyssa's bag from behind the portrait . It'll have Alyssa's Journal, which will be the final Wrenwood file you'll find in Resident Evil 9 Requiem . Next, you can check out where to find all Rhodes Hill Care Center files in RE9 next.

10 /10

Resident Evil Requiem

item.title: Resident Evil Requiem Ending Explained
item.description:
Resident Evil Requiem brings a brand-new chapter to life in the beloved action horror series, and it makes bold decisions that affect 30 years worth of lore. Thankfully, the big risks taken in Resident Evil Requiem pay off and bring Leon and Grace's stories to a thrilling and emotional climax.

Leon and Grace's paths cross early on in Resident Evil Requiem , causing them to bond incredibly quickly. By the end of everything, the duo have built a strong two-person team built on trust and shared trauma. Leon is put through his toughest challenges yet, and Grace is way out of her element. As the two work to investigate the mystery of Dr. Victor Gideon and Raccoon City Syndrome, wild revelations unfold in the game's finale. There are technically two endings in Resident Evil Requiem , but this article will focus on the true ending .

Major spoilers ahead for Resident Evil Requiem .

Resident Evil Requiem's True Ending Brings Everything Back to Raccoon City

Resident Evil Requiem 's endgame brings Leon and Grace to a devastated and desolate Raccoon City. Zeno, the leader of The Connections, and ex-Umbrella researcher Dr. Victor Gideon, are both convinced that Grace is the key to unleashing Elpis, a mysterious project that Oswell E. Spencer had been working on. Zeno and Gideon believe that Elpis is a virus that makes mind control possible, but it's locked in a high-tech vault deep under the Raccoon City ruins called the ARK. As Leon is busy taking on gigantic spiders, mutated plant life, and even Mr. X, Zeno and Gideon have kidnapped Grace to bring her to the ARK. Elpis can only be released via an unknown password, and the two villains think Grace knows what it is.

Grace Finds Out About Her True Nature and Leon Begins to Succumb to His Illness

Earlier in the story, Resident Evil Requiem makes it seem like Grace Ashcroft is the product of Umbrella experiments instead of Alyssa Ashcroft's biological daughter. This turns out to be half true. While briefly free of Zeno, Grace is able to watch an old video that her mother left behind before she was murdered. This video confirms that Alyssa is not Grace's actual mother, but it also disproves Zeno and Gideon's theories that Grace is the key to a new bioweapon. Grace is an orphan taken in by Spencer, and Alyssa eventually became her guardian after a sit-down interview with Spencer. In Alyssa's interview, Spencer states that he regrets everything that he's done with his research and that Grace is his "hope." Meanwhile, Leon is really struggling to stay alive. His Raccoon City Syndrome has reached late stages, and it seems everyone's favorite roundhouse-kicker is doomed.

In Resident Evil Requiem , it's revealed that The Connections and the U.S. government used Spencer as a scapegoat. Even though the game shows Spencer in a redeeming light, it doesn't erase the atrocities he committed.

Grace is the Key to Elpis, But Not in the Way Zeno and Gideon Expected

Grace meets back up with a barely-alive Leon and the two return to the Elpis vault to face Zeno. Grace has a plan, and Leon puts his full trust in her. "Hope" is also something Alyssa called Grace before she was murdered at the Wrenwood Hotel, which leads Grace to realize that the password that unlocks Elpis is "hope." The password gives players the choice to either destroy or release Elpis. If players choose to release Elpis, this kicks off the true ending. After learning of Spencer's regret, Grace concludes that Elpis isn't actually a bioweapon at all. It's an antidote that makes all bioweapons obsolete. Zeno doesn't know he's being tricked, though, and enthusiastically injects a vial into his body. His powers quickly deteriorate as Gideon reminds him that the two simply theorized about what Elpis could be instead of knowing for sure. A power-hungry Gideon suddenly mutates and decapitates Zeno with his arm.

Leon and Victor Gideon Have One Final Showdown

Leon is practically at death's door at this point, but Grace quickly injects him with Elpis, saving his life. This leads to a two-stage boss fight against Gideon as he mutates into a giant monstrosity that has become a staple for endgame Resident Evil boss fights. Leon defeats Gideon and finds Grace nearby. Because of the surrounding destruction, there doesn't seem to be any exit, leading Grace and Leon to accept that this is the end of their road. Leon vows to stay by Grace's side until they both die.

Resident Evil Requiem is Ultimately a Story About Hope

Thankfully, Leon and Grace live. Chris Redfield's Hound Wolf Squad arrive to save the duo. Unfortunately, Chris Redfield is not in Resident Evil Requiem , but the finale seems to tease a potential team-up between him and Leon. Leon is cured, a vial has been saved to also cure Sherry, and the discovery of the ARK lab becomes international news.

Leon and Grace Get a Happy Ending After Going Through Hell

Both Leon and Grace struggle with their own personal guilt throughout Resident Evil Requiem 's story. However, both find redemption in different ways. Leon now leaves Raccoon City with memories of victory instead of regret, providing some much-needed inner healing. Grace returns to her job at the FBI and is able to adopt a now-cured Emily, the little girl from the Rhodes Chronic Care Facility. It's an emotional full-circle moment that now puts her in Alyssa's shoes.

The Bad Ending : The ARK begins to self-destruct after putting in the wrong password, but Grace is able to escape. However, Leon is left to fight Zeno. The latter easily overpowers the sick Leon and shoots him in the head, killing him. The ARK platform crumbles, and the two fall into the abyss.

That Happiness May Not Last For Long, Though

A brief ending cutscene shows a group of mysterious armored soldiers exploring the ARK rubble. Their identity is unknown, but one states that they're working to obtain the "objective" before the "wolves" show up first. This likely means that the ARK holds more secrets than just Elpis. The "wolves" probably refer to Chris Redfield's Hound Wolf Squad. There's no way to know for sure at this point, but this scene definitely feels like the next Resident Evil game could be setting up a Chris Redfield-led story that potentially features Leon as a partner.

10 /10

Resident Evil Requiem

item.title: "It's Basically Like a Sequel" Doom: The Dark Ages Director Hypes Upcoming DLC
item.description:
Doom: The Dark Ages director Hugo Martin is getting fans excited about the new DLC coming for the run-and-gun shooter, suggesting it will feel like a brand-new game. The newest entry in the beloved shooter series from developer id Software made waves following its release, seeing praise from fans and critics alike. Doom: The Dark Ages quickly became the biggest release in the developer's history, amassing 3 million players within just a week of its launch and winning "Innovation in Accessibility" at the 2025 Game Awards. The game has also received multiple updates with new content after its debut.

Doom: The Dark Ages brought some big changes to the franchise's reboot series with its launch in May 2025. Developer id Software put a heavy focus on melee combat within the game, giving the Doom Slayer new weapons like gauntlets, a mace, and a flail to mow down enemies. The developer continued to push out new updates for Dark Ages following its release, adding the Ripatorium as an endless arena with increasingly powerful enemies for players to fight. Now, the director for Doom: The Dark Ages is getting fans hyped up for the game's upcoming DLC.

Doom: The Dark Ages Director Teases Big Plans for New DLC

During a recent Slayers Club Live broadcast, Hugo Martin dropped some cryptic hints about the future of Doom: The Dark Ages . Martin shared that recent playtests of the DLC saw the director completely changing his playstyle from Dark Ages ' pre-existing content, saying it was "nothing like" the streamed gameplay. Martin addressed fan concerns about the long wait time for news about the DLC, but stressed that the DLC is "huge" and even claimed it was "basically a sequel" to Doom: The Dark Ages . Despite the exciting hints about the scale of the Doom DLC , Martin did confirm that an official teaser trailer was still "a little ways out there."

Though Martin did not directly confirm any new content, the director did share some hints about the DLC for Doom: The Dark Ages . Martin coyly alluded to one suggestion from a viewer, asking for an alternate game mode that focused more on Perfect Dodges and counterattacks. Martin also touched on the importance of keeping true to fan expectations of the franchise, while also being able to innovate and do new things with Doom: The Dark Ages . The director did tease a potential new weapon with a special movement ability, though he did not go into specifics.

Hugo Martin also touched on some of the changes made in Doom: The Dark Ages , both regarding its style of gameplay and theming. The previously-mentioned alterations to Doom 's gameplay also came with a significant shift in the timeline of the franchise, with Dark Ages set as a distant prequel to Hell's invasion of Earth. Glory Kills saw big adjustments with the release of Dark Ages , changing the flashy kill animations to be largely reserved for bosses while making them far more rare for normal enemies.

The sizable DLC planned for Doom: The Dark Ages could potentially line up with a huge milestone for the franchise. id Software recently celebrated the 35th anniversary of the Doom studio's founding, hinting at big plans for its anniversary celebrations. id Software's 35th anniversary also lines up with another major anniversary for a game connected to the studio, with classic shooter franchise Quake set to officially turn 25 on June 22. The developer notably did not confirm any specifics of its plans at the time, simply suggesting fans should "stay tuned" for more from the studio. id Software's 30th anniversary may turn out to be a big one, with Doom 's massive DLC and lots more potentially in store.

8 /10

DOOM: The Dark Ages

item.title: All Mr. Racoon Memoriams in Raccoon City in Resident Evil Requiem
item.description:
There are 13 Mr. Raccoons to find and shoot in Raccoon City , a segment of Resident Evil Requiem in which you will be playing entirely as Leon. With 9 Mr. Raccoons in East Raccoon City and an additional 4 in the Raccoon City Center, there's going to be quite a bit of running and quite a bit of shooting.

If you want to know where to find all Mr. Raccoons in Resident Evil Requiem, we've got you covered. Below, you'll find the chronological order in which you can find all Mr. Raccoon locations in Raccoon City to ensure you're one step closer to completing these RE9 collectibles.

All Mr. Raccoon Locations in East Raccoon City

Mr. Raccoon #11 (Café Oasis)

As you arrive in East Raccoon City, you can traverse through the street to find Cafe Oasis, the building attached to the Applegate Hotel. Behind the bar in Cafe Oasis, in a cabinet, is the 11th Mr. Raccoon.

Make sure to grab this one before heading to the Applegate Hotel, or you'll have to backtrack later.

Mr. Raccoon #12 (Logistics Warehouse Roof)

Head to the rooftop of the Logistics Warehouse, accessed via the south building at the Central Camp. On the roof, where you grabbed the Distributor detonator part, you can look to the northwest to find the 12th Mr. Raccoon on top of a van on the highway.

Mr. Raccoon #13 (Underground Parking Garage)

With the Cedarbrook Apartments Key, head to the Apartment Building Gate just east of the Central Camp. Enter downstairs into the Underground Parking Garage, and head into the first room in the north hallway. Face the east wall, and you will find the 13th Mr. Raccoon on some boxes.

Mr. Raccoon #14 (Street)

After exiting the Underground Parking Garage, you can head north to find an abandoned and rusted bus. In the front window of the bus, you can find the 14th Mr. Raccoon.

Mr. Raccoon #15 (Gas Station)

After exiting the Underground Parking Garage, you can continue north to find a ladder that will take you across the back of a truck, and then you can drop into the Gas Station. From the interior of the Gas Station, you can find the 15th Mr. Raccoon on a shelf.

Mr. Raccoon #16 (Cedarbrook Apartments)

Head through the front doors of Cedarbrook Apartments and go up the stairs. Take a right of the locked door and drop down to get the Crank, then return to the locked door that needs this Crank item. Go up the ladder, and take a right back into the building to find the 16th Mr. Racoon in a rusted fridge.

Mr. Raccoon #17 (Street)

After obtaining the Gas Can with Fuel, activate the Gas Generator north of the Logistics Warehouse, on the street just west of the Gas Station. This will activate a shortcut back to the Central Camp via a large metal structure. Stand on the metal structure, and look to the open pipe on the left to find the 17th Mr. Raccoon.

Mr. Raccoon #18 (Ridgewood Station)

With the Gas Can with Fuel, activate the Fuel Generator north of the Central Camp. Inside the junkyard area, you will find a ladder. Take the ladder down into Ridgewood Station, and follow through the left tunnel to enter the station. Continue west, where in the train, you can find the 18th Mr. Raccoon on a seat on top of a box.

Mr. Raccoon #19 (Willis Tower)

With the Gas Can with Fuel, return to the Logistics Warehouse Roof via the elevator at the Central Camp. You can now fill up the Gas Generator to access a zipline to the Willis Tower. Head upstairs and look to the southwest wall to find the 19th and final East Raccoon City Mr. Raccoon on a shelf.

All Mr. Raccoon Locations in Raccoon City Center

Mr. Raccoon #20 (Street)

After driving the motorcycle to Raccoon City Center, go left to the west area instead of through the alleyway. Among the rubble beside the rusted tanker, you can find the 20th Mr. Raccoon.

You won't be able to return to this Mr. Raccoon if you enter the R.P.D., so it's best to do this first.

Mr. Raccoon #21 (Operations Room)

Venture west of the Main Hall to head into the West Office. From here, head north to the Operations Room. At the west wall, among some rubble, you can find the 21st Mr. Raccoon. You may even spot Tofu hiding behind a pillar if you're lucky!

Mr. Raccoon #22 (Library)

From the Main Hall, head west through the hallways to reach the staircase that takes you into the Library. Head to the north end of the Library and look south at the bookshelf. The 22nd Mr. Raccoon is hiding behind a pile of books.

Mr. Raccoon #23 (Gun Shop Kendo)

After exiting R.P.D., head north to Gun Shop Kendo. After the cutscene, you will want to head into the alleyway in the east of Gun Shop Kendo. You'll find an Umbrella billboard, and to the left of the billboard in the window, is the 23rd and final Raccoon City Center Mr. Raccoon.

10 /10

Resident Evil Requiem
